intro: Arrabidaea pullei, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and showy, candle-like inflorescences. Arrabidaea pullei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal and sandy soils.
